intro: Euploca greggii, commonly known as Gregg's euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Euploca greggii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
